major_events: Civil war between Imperials and Stormcloaks intensifies
High King Torygg was killed by Ulfric Stormcloak
Thalmor influence in Skyrim grows stronger
Battle of Whiterun looms as both sides pressure Jarl Balgruuf
Galmar Stone-Fist remains alive and commands Stormcloak forces
College expedition at Saarthal uncovered a sealed Eye of Magnus chamber; Thalmor Advisor Ancano was present.
Pelagia Farm giant slain; Companions involvement becomes local legend

post_dragon_crisis.timeline_note: Ancient dragon lore speaks of their return, but none have been seen recently
post_dragon_crisis.dragon_knowledge: Dragons are creatures of legend, with few recent sightings
post_dragon_crisis.blades_status: Nearly extinct, few remain in hiding

rumors_and_news: Caravans whisper that a Companion dragged bound Silver Hand through Whiterun after saving a roadside family from intimidation.
Hunters near Falkreath claim the Glenmoril Coven's smoke went still overnight; crows gathered, and the woods fell quiet in the wrong way.
Pelagia Farm rumor: a lone Companion with two Skyforge axes felled the wandering giant in a blur of wind and verse.
Whiterun whispers: a Thalmor Justiciar was captured at a Talos shrine sting after striking first; witnesses are being quietly questioned.
Rumor: A blue glow poured from the Saarthal excavation at dusk, and the College party returned shaken, speaking in whispers about an "Eye".
Galmar Stone-Fist was seen rallying Stormcloak troops after the west-wall clash â€” bruised, furious, and very much alive.
Caravans report College mages traveling north under guard; Winterhold locals are muttering about 'another Collapse waiting to happen.'
Civil war tensions rise as both sides prepare for battle
Jarl Balgruuf refuses to take sides in the civil war
Thalmor Justiciars are becoming more aggressive
Bandits are becoming bolder on the roads
Strange reports of dragon sightings in distant lands
active_threats: Silver Hand vendetta: escalated attention on Companions, focused on a 'Great Bear' rumored to be hunting their hunters.
Thalmor narrative control: pressure on witnesses and officials in Whiterun after the Justiciar incident
Thalmor surveillance increasing around the College of Winterhold and notable relics
notes: Campaign Focus: The civil war between Imperials and Stormcloaks dominates Skyrim. The Thalmor work behind the scenes to keep both sides weak. Jarls are being forced to choose sides, and the common people are caught in the middle. The Battle of Whiterun will be a pivotal moment.
